node.background: The catastrophic fires that ravaged California communities for four straight years set records, putting policymakers across the West on notice: as global temperatures rise, natural disasters are expected to occur more frequently and be more destructive. States like Colorado have responded by increasing funding to fight fires and prevent them. The maintenance of power lines is another issue. The federal government is commiting more resources to the problem as well, even as the president has sparred with state leaders. But the federal governmentâ€™s role could expand in unexpected ways if the trend continues.
node.questionText: What would your administration do in response to the proliferation of wildfires in the West?
